Package org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.fsa

Class Containment

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractAlgorithm
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.fsa.Containment
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, Algorithm, AlgorithmListener, Containment<FSA,​FSA,​InputSequence>
public class Containment
extends AbstractAlgorithm
implements Containment<FSA,​FSA,​InputSequence>
This is a class for checking containment between two Büchi automata.
Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    ContainmentResult<InputSequence> isContained​(FSA aut1, FSA aut2)
    Tests if the language of the first finite state automaton is contained in the language of the second finite state automaton.

    Checks if an ω-automaton with a propositional alphabet is contained in a QPTL formula.

    Checks if a QPTL formula is contained in an ω-automaton with a propositional alphabet.

  • Method Details

    • isContained

      public ContainmentResult<InputSequence> isContained​(FSA aut1, FSA aut2)
      Tests if the language of the first finite state automaton is contained in the language of the second finite state automaton. Currently, only classic finite state automata and ω-automata that can be converted to NBW are supported.
      Specified by:
      isContained in interface Containment<FSA,​FSA,​InputSequence>
      Parameters:
      aut1 - a finite state automaton
      aut2 - a finite state automaton
      Returns:
      the result of the containment test
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the containment test of aut1 and aut2 is unsupported

    • isContained

      public ContainmentResult<InputSequence> isContained​(FSA aut, QPTL formula)
      Checks if an ω-automaton with a propositional alphabet is contained in a QPTL formula. The automaton should be able to be converted to an equivalent NBW.
      Parameters:
      aut - an ω-automaton, with a propositional alphabet, that can be converted to an equivalent NBW
      formula - a QPTL formula
      Returns:
      the result of the containment test
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the alphabet type of aut is not propositional or aut cannot be converted to an equivalent NBW, or the formula cannot be translated to an NBW by the default translation algorithm

    • isContained

      public ContainmentResult<InputSequence> isContained​(QPTL formula, FSA aut)
      Checks if a QPTL formula is contained in an ω-automaton with a propositional alphabet. The automaton should be able to be converted to an equivalent NBW.
      Parameters:
      formula - a QPTL formula
      aut - an ω-automaton, with a propositional alphabet, that can be converted to an equivalent NBW
      Returns:
      the result of the containment test
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the alphabet type of aut is not propositional or aut cannot be converted to an equivalent NBW, or the formula cannot be translated to an NBW by the default translation algorithm
